comments.body: I don't know what I(command) (and later on, I(prompt) stands for and I wonder if that's just a gap in my ansible knowlege, or something the average network engineer would also stumble to understand.  There is also the issue of 'prompt' is used to describe what 'prompt' is.  I find the earlier base description a little easier to understand "Specifies what to evaluate from the output of the command and what conditionals to apply".  I don't know how much of that sentence still applies though?

So this is a particularly badly worded one. Some commands, when run, will ask (prompt) the user for confirmation or more information before proceeding. The `prompt` argument is a list of regexes to match text coming from the device against to determine if such an interaction is happening, at which point the value in `answer` is automatically supplied.

And `I(...)` is just a hint to the ansible documentation generator that the value in the parens is an option name. See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/dev_guide/developing_modules_documenting.html#formatting-functions
